bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J. Randin, February 16, 1942

div1.p: Hench informs Randin that he has been sent the wrong photographs and again describes the one he is seeking.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J. Randin, February 16, 1942
div1.opener:
Y F
February 16, 1942
Dr. J. Randin
Ciudad Militar
Cuartel “Cabo Parrado”
Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Randin:
div1.p:
I appreciate very greatly receiving the two
airplane photographs which you sent me with your letter
dated January 16. It was very courteious indeed of you
to send them. I regret, however, that one of them I
had already received from Dr. Ara and the other was not the
picture which I had been trying so hard to get, namely
the one mentioned in the enclosed letter which I sent to
Dr. Machado de Cardenas. I am especially anxious to get
the particular airplane photograph which was printed in
the Revista de la Sanidad Militar Ano II Num. 2 on page
103, as that particular photograph shows not only the
hospital at Military City but is the only one which shows
the tree across the La Playa Railroad track which was the
site where Dr. Lazear died. I would greatly appreciate
it if you or Dr. Machado could get me a glossy print of
that particular photograph and whatever expense there is
connected with it I should be glad indeed to pay.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
